member_organisations:
Members are: Unilever, Friesland Campina, Pepsico, Nigerian Heart Foundation, Vim co Jim Foundation (Czech Republic), independent president, president of the Choices International Scientific Committee (advisor) 
Agenda member: Ik Kies Bewust Foundation (The Netherlands)
fields_of_interest: Consumers, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives:
1. Choices International represents the national Choices programs in Czech Republic and The Netherlands. 
2. Choices International supports national healthy food logo program in Croatia and upocoming initiatives such as in Bulgaria  
3. Choices International drives the European Positive Logo Movement that brings together the 11 European countries with a positive logo 
4. Choices International supports the Choices European Scientific Committee that stimulates and monitors European studies on the impact of front-of-pack labelling e.g. CLYMBOL 
5. Choices International shares knowledge with DG Santé and JRC upon request
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: Member of the Consumer Goods Forum
relevant_communication:
1. European Logo Round Tables 2012 (Brussels), 2014 ( Copenhagen), 2016 (Amsterdam), 2018 (Copenhagen) 
2. Video cliup on European positive logo movement 
3. Choices stakeholder events in 2014, 2015 
4. Participation via Schuttelaar & Partners in FLABEL and CLYMBOL research projects 
5. Session at the High Level Conference on Food product improvement, Febr 2016 in Amsterdam
goals__remit: The goal of the Choices programme is to support national initiatives for healthier food choices by means of a program consisting of a positive logo, product refurmulation and consumer education.
